meanings.definition: A supporting frame or structure that is subordinate to a main frame.
meanings.sent1: The subframe of the chair provides additional stability.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic inspected the subframe of the car for any signs of damage.
meanings.sent3: The tiny ant decided to build its subframe using toothpicks.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was the subframe that held together the joyous family photo.
meanings.sent5: The subframe of the building creaked under the weight of the heavy snow.

meanings.definition: A frame within a larger frame, typically used in construction or automotive engineering.
meanings.sent1: The subframe of the window was carefully installed before the outer frame.
meanings.sent2: The subframe of the car chassis provides structural support.
meanings.sent3: The subframe of the house was like a secret compartment hidden within.
meanings.sent4: His words acted as the subframe for her confidence to grow.
meanings.sent5: The subframe of the bridge held the weight of the passing trucks.
